test_scenarios.scenario_name: Data Validation for Product Category ID
test_scenarios.description: This scenario is designed to verify that all products in the database have a valid category_id associated with them.
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Retrieve all products from the database and check if each product has a valid category_id.
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN 0 ELSE 1 END FROM products WHERE category_id IS NULL OR category_id NOT IN (SELECT category_id FROM categories);
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If it returns 0, the test fails.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: SQL Query Testing for Product Category ID
test_scenarios.description: This scenario is designed to test the efficiency and correctness of SQL queries retrieving products based on their category_id.
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Run a query to retrieve all products with a specific category_id and measure the time it takes to execute.
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END FROM products WHERE category_id = 1;
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If it returns 0, the test fails. The execution time should also be within acceptable limits.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Data Integrity Check for Product Category ID
test_scenarios.description: This scenario is designed to check the data integrity of the product category_id by ensuring that no two products have the same category_id.
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Retrieve all products from the database and check if any two products have the same category_id.
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) = COUNT(DISTINCT category_id) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END FROM products;
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If it returns 0, the test fails.
